resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
jvictorhuguenin opened a new pull request #11471:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11471


   Seeing dramatic differences in Gandiva processing time during filter operations for queries with a LIKE filter on a character field with a reserved character (-,/& etc). The version with a reserved character in the string is considerably slower than a similar filter without a reserved character. For patterns like %abc% and %ab-c%, the latter wasn't being optimized to become an is_substr expression because of the regex used to identify those cases.


--

jvictorhuguenin commented on pull request #11471:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11471#issuecomment-947210953


   I could fix the REGEX for the is_substr matching, but I'm still trying to figure out the right REGEX for both starts_with and ends_with matching so then can also accept reserved characters.


--

vvellanki commented on a change in pull request #11471:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11471#discussion_r741050024



##########
File path: cpp/src/gandiva/like_holder.cc
##########
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ namespace gandiva {
 
 RE2 LikeHolder::starts_with_regex_(R"((\w|\s)*\.\*)");
 RE2 LikeHolder::ends_with_regex_(R"(\.\*(\w|\s)*)");
-RE2 LikeHolder::is_substr_regex_(R"(\.\*(\w|\s)*\.\*)");
+RE2 LikeHolder::is_substr_regex_(R"(\.\*(\w|\s|\W)*\.\*)");

Review comment:
       I am not sure if you can include all non-word characters.
   
   From https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax:
   
   \W | not word characters (≡ [^0-9A-Za-z_])
   -- | --
   
   Does RE2 support matching with non-ascii character sets?

##########
File path: cpp/src/gandiva/like_holder.cc
##########
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ namespace gandiva {
 
 RE2 LikeHolder::starts_with_regex_(R"((\w|\s)*\.\*)");

Review comment:
       You can include characters like - to this list. Same with ends_with optimisation




--

ursabot commented on pull request #11471:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11471#issuecomment-1026514330


   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = adfb91302231418c5de53d427ddb7e8c3b6abee1 and contender = bf0ee3f9c50e10de1237bb426138b1734b7c934d. bf0ee3f9c50e10de1237bb426138b1734b7c934d is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Scheduled] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/ea88e1db3ed54ace950a544460b33c93...c6d8e51dab46453d824268e1d3b37f09/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/0aaddd68a6a5461489eaf1b42f7ed356...65554a70bc184fe8990d7e9579cf428c/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-thinkcentre-m75q](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/ebeb4a2ccbc9400ab9c4508a615bf39a...14749ae553b5411dac9944a0b02988e4/)
   Supported benchmarks:
   ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2: Supported benchmark langs: Python. Runs only benchmarks with cloud = True
   ursa-i9-9960x: Supported benchmark langs: Python, R, JavaScript
   ursa-thinkcentre-m75q: Supported benchmark langs: C++, Java
   


--

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Seeing dramatic differences in Gandiva processing time during filter operations for queries with a LIKE filter on a character field with a reserved character (-,/& etc). The version with a reserved character in the string is considerably slower than a similar filter without a reserved character. For patterns like %abc% and %ab-c%, the latter wasn't being optimized to become an is_substr expression because of the regex used to identify those cases.
fields.summary: [C++][Gandiva] Fix performance bug with LIKE expressions with reserved characters
